means: （尤指儿童）哭着不停地抱怨（某事）( grizzle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was an old man with grey, grizzled hair.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一位头发花白的老人。

sentence.Network_en: They were odd and grizzled or wrinkled storekeepers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们是一些古里古怪,头发花白,满脸皱纹的杂货店老板.

sentence.Network_en: The old dog had a grizzled muzzle.
sentence.Network_cn: 那条老狗的口鼻部分有灰斑.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 以g开头的英语英文单词 ... gristmill 磨粉厂 grizzled 灰色的,头发斑白的 groan 哼，呻吟 n.呻吟.
They were odd and grizzled or wrinkled storekeepers ., 他们是一些古里古怪 , 头发花白 , 满脸皱纹的杂货店老板.
...巨大，下颚总沾满烟草的碎末；当你毕业了，他已经是个白发苍苍（grizzled）的老兵了──即便你还不晓得「白发苍苍」意味著什麽。
freckle是什么意思... ... 〖greying;grizzled〗 头发斑白,常用来形容大哥 〖grey-templed〗 斑白的鬓发,指大哥.

list.abs: to this end , the grizzled Chaplain petitioned Lord Macraggeauthority to forge a new body of Ultramarines , chosen from the survivors of the Tyrannic wars .最后，老牧师向马库拉格之主提出了一个新建议：挑选那些泰伦战争中幸存的战士们，铸造一支全新的极限战士部队。
a grizzled man with a beak like nose ., 鼻子像鸟嘴 , 头发斑白的男人.
Then the elephants put their grizzled heads and pondered., 因此大象将它们毛茸茸的头聚拢一处 , 商议起来.
a common burrowing rodent ( Marmota mona ) of northern and eastern North America , a-legged heavy-set body and grizzled brownish fur .北美土拨鼠，美洲旱獭北美北部和东部的一种普通的穴居啮齿类动物（北美土拨鼠)，有短腿、健壮的身体和灰棕色的皮毛。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from the adjective grizzle + -ed

entry.def: A grizzled person or a person with grizzled hair has hair that is grey or partly grey.

example.tran: 头发花白、靠养老金过活的老人

example.ex: He was an old man with grey, grizzled hair.
example.tran: 他是一位头发花白的老人。

means.word_mean: 1. having dark hairs mixed with gray or white

auth_sentence.content: The old wolf-coloured woods, grizzled with snow.
auth_sentence.res_content: The old wolf-coloured woods, grizzled with snow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The old wolf-coloured woods, grizzled with snow.

auth_sentence.res_content: He was a fine figure of a man...with a grizzled beard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was a fine figure of a man...with a grizzled beard.

auth_sentence.content: The baby beside her...had grizzled hungrily.
